Presenting Complaints (Symptoms):
1. Excessive conscientiousness
2. Unreasonable insistence on others to work
3. Preoccupation with deadline and schedule
History: Patient finds it difficult to work with one of her colleagues. It bothers him to the point that he gets preoccupied with thoughts of not meeting the deadline which will make him look bad. He tried to work on it through several ways like talking to others about it, taking suggestions, complaining about the co-worker but nothing has worked so far. He is preoccupied with further steps he can take to solve this issue.
Current Mental Status Examination: General behavior- Rapport established; Speech: Productivity- Increased; Affect- Anxious; Thought: Content- preoccupation with perfection; Insight- Grade 1
Issues discussed in Current Session: It was discussed that patient was stressed about his colleague's work performance which, according to him, had an impact on him too. He expressed different things he has tried and  the support he tried taking from others so far which has not been of much help. Some ways of dealing with it which has not been tried in the past were discussed and patient wanted to try them too.
Reflections by the therapist: Rapport was established with the patient; He had a preoccupation with perfection in terms of meeting deadlines and schedules and insisted his co-worker to work according to him. Problem solving approach was tapped on which helped in maintaining patient's trust as for the current stage he lack insight.
